title: Is anybody else extremely disappointed with how GoW Ragnarök played out?
self_text: Major Spoilers  All through GoW ‘18 we hear about how bloody and sadistic Thor is, meanwhile Baldr, Magni and Modi are psychotic. They build up that Asgard is basically a bastion for violence and debauchery. The writers made it seem like we were going to be going up against a pantheon of mad men.   Then, they all become sympathetic villains… even Odin. Unlike ‘18, this game is filled with one sappy event after another. Thor has a sweet family, he changes his mind in the end. Greta fully forgives Kratos. Midgardians take in Thors family. Freya even forgives Odin in the end… I guess they didn’t want to do GoW 3 all over again (even though they built up that story in ‘18).  I’m just so incredibly disappointed with how they went with it. I thought it was such a lousy dynamic. Everyone was kind of a good guy. It felt like there were no stakes at all. I know Atreus is Loki, but it just felt so out of place for him to come and go from Asgard as he pleased.  It all felt so PG too, which is fucking insane to me because this is Kratos we’re talking about… not saying he needed to be a bloodthirsty maniac, but SOMEBODY did! It was just one harmless character after the next. I got so incredibly bored halfway through, but I was holding out hope that Odin was going to kidnap Atreus and Kratos would have to go psycho to get him back. So something would happen.   But we just got this sappy ass lukewarm story the entire way through. I’m so depressed.

title: Suggestions from a returning player
self_text: The game is becoming stale   I believe that after a few wipes there is very little content in the game to keep me interested. Battlestate Games have tackled this by implementing wipes and daily quests which are good addition to this, but not enough. For me, when I look back the most enjoyable aspect was learning the game, I believe that for the game to emulate this it would need to have major changes between wipes.  A few examples of this could be to change locations of: loot spawns, marked rooms, scav spawns, barter trades etc. Basically add some randomness that requires to relearn certain aspects of the game.  Also quests could change, instead of having the same quests Battlestate Games could create hundreds that alternate between each wipe. Or they could have a more personal approach and have a main theme or story each wipe which reflect on unique quests.  ​   Lobby for hackers   Hackers are clearly present in the game, which is natural due to the economic nature of the game. Although Battlestate Game has been doing a large amount of work to tackle them, they keep appearing. Clearly this approach doesn't seem to be working as the main problem is that the developers have to spend time dealing with hackers rather than adding content and improving the game.  The Cycle: Frontier, a looter shooter, has addressed the issue in a unique way. They use a system called trusted matchmaking, once a player becomes trusted they get matched to other trusted players. Cheaters are also pooled into their own lobbies. There are multiple factors that go into determining when you are trusted such as: numbers of hours played, lifetime of the steam account, stats in-game etc. Also if you get killed by a hacker the items you brought into the raid are returned back to you.  Although Battlestate Games may be hesitant to introduce any sort of "matchmaking" system, I believe this may be necessary to combat hackers.  ​   Reminders in main menu before joining raids   Currently if your health is low you when starting a raid you get a warning. I believe this is beneficial but should also be applied to other areas as well such as: low durability in armour, mags not filled, bags not empty, food and fluid is low.  I understand that EFT is a hardcore game and has little to no hand holding. However I don't believe forgetting to do something in the lobby is reflective of your in-game skill. Furthermore loading into a raid with the above negative effects detracts from the overall experience, it simply leaves you angry and frustrated. Games are primarily meant to be fun.  New players in particular are already having to learn a lot and will naturally forget some things, informing them of mistakes before they are made will increase player retention and enjoyment. Although I'm sure this also affects experienced players, the number of times I have died for forgetting to eat a drink is more than I can count over the course of several wipes.  ​   Filtering   The filtering in the game menu currently highlights items in set categories, however I don't think this is really helpful.  I believe instead a more useful approach would be to display an inventory with just the filtered items at the top, including anything in containers being brought out and shown.

title: [Spoilers Extended] Shireen "Bright Reborn"
self_text: Shireen's name may be a clue in favor of the theory that she will be sacrificed to R'llor. I think there is some wordplay going on here.  Separated into the two syllables "Shir" and "Reen" the name can be read as "Bright-Reborn" using Old English (which George very commonly uses) and French.  >Shere or Shire is derived from the Old English "scir", meaning  "fair, bright, shining" .  >René meaning  born again or reborn  in French is derived from the Latin name Renatus.  Why think French? Because the name Shireen or "Shereen" is also a French name from the word "chéri"  (Listen to Google translate French to English say chéri. The pronunciation is almost exactly the same) . Also George likes French and the history of France as he motioned when discussing the book  Les Rois Maudits  which was an inspiration for ASOIAF.  This reading of the name very closely matches the language used when a follower of R'llor discusses fire sacrifice or death.  >"Let these girls be reborn in light. - Victarion  >Better that they be reborn into the light." - Selyse   The name "Shireen" is a play on words.  Within the "darling" Shireen or "chérie"  hides a more sinister meaning related to R'llor worship.

title: Something in my PC first died, then I killed the PSU. A repair dwindle boogaloo. A man versus technology narration that will move all rationale you've got left into computer repair. A simple ... ;;; Perchance ;;;.
self_text: Hello Redditors! Very,  very  funny story happened today. Well, not for me, but that's not the point.     It had been a beautiful morning of Eight of November. A young, yet aspiring man hath riseth from his bed, waddled to his seat, and henceforth the story fully began. He awoke his computer from sleep as always, and frittered away the time. Seconds felt like pure blissful eons, as he scrolled through the endless internet. He decided to start a long dead game called Evolve, and start it he did, indeed. 10 minutes into a thousandth match of his life, his PC  suddenly   shut down . This has happened before.     "A power outage it must've been!"  , - he thinks to himself. But, as swiftly as he came to that conclusion, he just as quickly noticed the contradiction in front of him, as well as above him. Ceiling lights remained on, and router remained on as well. By this time - the computer has already started turning itself back on. He waits 15 seconds for the splash image to arrive - but it never does. So, he resets the computer. Still nothing.  Coincidentally, he notices that the mouse and keyboard lights aren't coming on either, so he grabs his pluggable USB voltage meter and plugs it into his USB ports - it reads 3.5V. 1.5V lower than intended. Instantly, frightened of data loss, he turns off the computer and removes all drives. Then, he grabs his voltmeter and measures 12V, 5V and 3.3V rails of the PSU. He reads 9.5V, 3.5V and 2.7V. All lower. Not good. He thinks it's a bad PSU when he notices that his motherboard has LED debugging LEDs. He reads what the LED says - the "CPU FAULT" LED is on. What could it be?   The introduction has been pretty simple so far.   Sudden shutdown  Won't post, but fans spin  Low voltage on all rails, but...  IS IT?   the story continues     He decides to remove the GPU as well, to prevent the damage to it, as he remembers the GPU has very sensitive MOSFETs that operate in a specific voltage saturation region and low voltage could kill them. Besides, the computer has integrated graphics, so that's not a problem.     Correcting steps, commence!       With only PSU, Motherboard, RAM and CPU remaining in the case, he decides to clear the BIOS via BIOS jumper as well as remove the BIOS battery for 30 minutes. He does it, no change.    He decides to shuffle ram, no change.    Voltage gets measured again, and this time..  SURPRISE!  Voltages are good and within spec! 12V, 4.98V and 3.3V!    He decides to take out PSU completely and to the paperclip test - it works great! So..  is it not the psu after all?      What do we know so far?   Voltages seem to be fine now  Still no post  Paperclip PSU test works ok   What happened next?    Stupidest moment of the story begins!   Next loical step in diagnostic would be reseating the CPU, possibly a new one and trying a second motherboard. As motherboards are more expensive than cheapest compatible CPU, he decides to get a CPU. However, the seller said it will have to wait until tomorrow, so he grows impatient. He searches the internet a bit about the problem a Youtube video about an user facing the exact same issue and solving it! And the comment section is FULL or positive replies. So he decides to try it!      How is it done?   Simple, turn on your PC that won't post, and then quickly shift your ON/OFF switch on the PSU back and forth, quickly as in crazy fast.  I did that once, nothing happened. Second time, nothing. I guessed I was too slow. Third time I'll try it super fast, I thought to myself. So I do it and - woo! Power outage for real!! Wait - that's my breakers popping. Wait hold on did my PSU just blo-----.   Yes.    Yes it did.    So all in all my beloved Redditors, now I'm stuck with a dead PSU and either a dead motherboard or CPU. I'm out of ideas or any thoughts at all, so I hoped that you'd have something to share in the comments.     Thanks for reading, love you all.

title: Need a new colony idea? Share your stories and be inspired by others!
self_text: Hi, I've been lurking here for some time and I often see people with really good ideas for their colonies stories, and other that would like to try something new. I've seen people with 400%+ age growth for a multi generational colony, a mad mechanitor trying to clone her dead daughter and much, much more. So let's share ideas and be inspired by others !  I'll start : I've started with a goody two shoes rich explorer named Huabuka, with a wholesome ideologion. Everything was nice and all, up until the archonexus quest. Huabuka wanted the Archonexus. She had given up her colony for the first part of the map, and arrived to a new, barren place. She researched the monument, but soon realised she needed more funds, so she enslaved raiders and built tons of clothing and managed, after some years, to get her hands on the second part of the map. But it wasn't enough, and going more and more against her ideologion, she attacked allied caravans, enslaved as much people as she could and began an enormous flake farm to finance her research. Her longtime friends and husband were against it, but her speaking talent got her free from them rebelling. And flake. Tons of it. When she got the last part, she burnt everything to the ground, killed all the slave and when to the final Archonexus monolith. After a tough battle, and blinded by greed, she killed her last standing companions and took it all for herself. Would this downward spiral from her convictions, aggravating her mood, enslaving innocent and killing everybody really worth it? Only she can tell, but she isn't there any more to tell us.   TL;DR  : a kind person with a charitable ideologion turned to slowly to madness, slavery, drugs and murder to fulfil her craving for mysteries  No need for special mods for this story :)

title: Just beat the game, and I miss the sense of whimsical fun from 1 and 2
self_text: I just beat the game, and while the gameplay was mostly excellent (when you actually got to play the hack and slash part...) and I don't even want to think about the story, the thing that really struck me was how grim and serious it all felt.  One of the things I liked about 1 and 2 was how vibrant and fun they were, despite the series stakes in both games, it truly felt like Bayonetta wasn't taking things  too  seriously and was genuinely having a good time, which served well to contrast the more serious moments when she did actually take things a little more seriously. By contrast, Bayonetta's attitude felt almost forced in this game and I only felt that whimsical fun in during the intro but with the apocalyptic backdrop (the other games had bright and sunny stages to contrast the literal hellscapes, something sorely lacking in Bayo 3) and constant death/destruction, the overall mood of the game was bleak, leaving Bayonetta's sassy quips falling flat.  Discussion of the story and gameplay has been done to death so I won't say anything on that, now that I've beaten the game the drastic tonal shift had me kinda bummed and I wanted to vent.

title: Any “doomsday gamers” here that have trouble placing much stake in modern systems and digital purchases?
self_text: I know a lot of thoughts on matters like these are  usually  worst case scenarios, but I’m just very uneasy about modern consoles/games and their potential caveats. I have more systems than I know what to do with, including a Series X and a Steam Deck. As nice as they are, my Series X is reduced to a space heater if I don’t have internet (game share with the gf, I know it’s my own decision to do that but still) and I know buying games through Valve is just as much of a “license to play” rather than actually owning something as any other digital storefront. I also just plainly don’t like digital purchases. Physical media is for me.   Things of this nature just really nag at me sometimes. They’re my games, dammit! If there’s a title out there I  truly  want to  own , I’ll usually track it down on the oldest console it’s available for. I collect a lot of PS3 games for this reason, and am about to begin grabbing some PS4 games I’m interested in too because I know neither of those systems are reliant on internet to just play things, and in the PS3’s case it’s easily jailbroken for even further preservation.   I know I’m not alone but I just wonder if any of you give it the level of thought that I do haha

title: How to find an accidentally hucked weapon?
self_text: So last night I was building an outpost on the pavers bordering the upper yard. I went to relocate one of the storage chests when I accidentally hit the very ridiculously defaulted key to throw a weapon. It was a level 9 toenail scimitar. Sadly I was facing the koi pond and the thing flew off the edge of the paver and down into oblivion.   I spent over 45 minutes scouring the pond surface and depths where I estimated the weapon would have gone but to no avail. As I have upgraded my other weapons to high levels I don’t have any supreme whetstones left to get another one back to level 9.   I found that weapons sink in water but all searches came up empty. I know that dropped or thrown weapons have a proximity icon when you get close to them but that doesn’t always work. Why it doesn’t work is beyond me and clearly is not working as intended as I’ve lost arrows and other hucked items in the past but miraculously picked them back up by running over where they just happened to land but a weapon like this may as well be a needle in a haystack to find in the koi pond provided that’s where it is in the first place.   Will this weapon eventually despawn or will it be somewhere in the world waiting for me to find it by chance?  Here’s an idea for the devs: Make an item that was thrown ALWAYS show up on the HUD regardless of how far you are from it!!!!  While I know that you can remap the keys I would love to know who in the hell thought it was a great idea to default the huck key to R???

title: More main character NPCs in the Tower
self_text: Especially given the events of this expansion year, I hope that Lightfall might see us revamp the Tower a bit. Sure, I'd love to see something like "Surprise! With the help of House Light and the assistance of Empress Caitl, we have rebuilt the original Tower/expanded the current Tower. Happy Lightfall." Even if we don't get this, I'd love to see more passive and active NPC representation.  Since the City Faction leaders have been gone, the Bazaar is an empty space with Ikora Rey and Hawthorne. It'd be great to have Cabal and Eliksni NPCs filling this space, even if as passive denizens. We have some Eliksni down by the Annex vending machine and drop-point, but as of now Eliksni have joined the Vanguard's tower defense forces thanks to the community event. Hopefully we see more of them around.  This feels like a great opportunity to have NPCs like Mithrax or Lord Saladin/Valus Forge representing our allies, even if just standing there with passive dialogue.  During Seasons of the Chosen and Splicer (maybe Hunt, too?), Osiris was a non-interactable NPC wandering near Ikora by the storage boxes and giving commentary.  Eris Morn is technically stationed on the Moon, but in lore she returns often to speak with Ikora as one of her Hidden. Every few hours it would be cool to see her wandering the Bazaar or down by the Drifter. Doesn't she have a laboratory space where Savathun's corpse is on an autopsy table?  Ana Bray is "technically" in the Tower studying the Rasputin engram with Caitl's Psions, but I don't think we have her physically present anywhere in the current Tower. That's a shame!  A passive dialogue Eido would likely be a treat, commenting on all sorts of human things.  ​  We already have this kind of thing happening in the HELM, where Crow is standing there but only does anything when specific parts of the current plot call for it.  Some small changes like this could really upgrade the Tower ambience and fill in some of the barren spaces we have now that a bunch of the old exotic quest content and secrets were sunset.

title: Funny story from a new player
self_text: A funny Dnd story from a first time player  Some context: This was my very first campaign and I was playing a cleric healer. I had a home brew item called a bag of holding aquarium edition. It was a bag of holding with a lot of sea creatures in it.   Story time: the DM was giving us the history of the town we were going to though a ranger we met on the road. About halfway into the history I ask if I can pull a fish out of the bag. He says sure and I rolled a nat20. He describes how I pull out a 5 foot long dog shark. Which I then proceeded to stroke like a cat periodically dunking it in the bag so it can breathe. About an hour later we are at a wizards tower and I have a great idea:  Me: “hey dm, if I roll at nat1 in religion can this dog shark evolve to have wings and breathe air because Christians don’t believe in evolution?”  Other players: “Pls allow it”  Dm: “you know what, sure why not”   I roll BOOM nat1. Ladies and gentlemen I introduce Spot the Flying dog shark.  It was a lot of fun. Spot sadly died to save another player by body blocking. The best boy:)  The Dm gave Spot his own stat block too :)  Thanks for reading!

title: What made the big three so successful in the west compared to other shows?
self_text: I've recently been wondering, what exactly was it that made Anime like Naruto, One Piece, Bleach, Dragonball and Pokemon blow up as much as they did in the West, compared to many other titles. I know, that I've mentioned the big three in the title. However, this question in my opinion applies to all of the shows that became mainstream hits during the late 90s, early 2000s.  Was it the fact that those shows had plenty of episodes compared to other shows, especially coming out after or during the OVA craze of the 80s and 90s?  Or were they just better marketed and thus managed to reach the masses?  Or was it merely a coincidence, simply because they were aired at the perfect time for kids to watch after coming home from school?  Did they do anything so spectacularly different from other (western) shows that were airing at the time?  And most importantly, why have other (modern) Anime failed to replicate this success. Sure, we have new titles that are extremely successful like MHA, AoT or recently Chainsaw Man. But I'd argue that they are nowhere near as popular, especially outside of the Anime fandom.  What do you guys think? I would love to hear your thoughts on the matter.

title: This is going to be a longshot, but I need help finding parts to the 20th Anniversary Watch that Seiko sold in Japan in 2019.
self_text: My wife got me this watch as an anniversary gift in 2019.  Her parents live in Japan, and it was a whole ordeal, and I am so grateful for all of them and their efforts - the watch is an absolute marvel.   The only issue is the band.  It was the largest size band that Japan had to offer, but my arm size is just a little bit bigger.  I  went to a watch dealer a couple of years back to re-band it, but the band he put on wasn't a perfect fit, and one of the clasps broke in the process.  What I want is, an original replacement clasp (that is, the little trapezoidal piece that connects the band to the watch, itself), as well as a few original links (5 should do it), for it to be able to fit my arm.  I'd love nothing more than to wear this all the time.  I've already contacted SEIKO and they were not much help, saying that the watch was a limited edition, and used a specific band that is virtually impossible to get parts for.  There are some bands I've found that  may  work, but it is my absolute preference to just extend the length of the original.  So, I'm hoping to source the parts from here, as a last resort.  I'd also be willing to pay for shipment and the parts, themselves.  Just...anything short of buying a second watch would be excellent.  Thank you guys for any help you can offer.

title: Rapid Fire stratagem + Bolter discipline clarification
self_text: Hey everyone  Over the weekend we had a couple of games with my group of friends, and playing Space Marines we had a bit of a debate concerning the Rapid fire rules:  Context: 5 man intercessor squad with rapid fire bolters, that had not moved. Target ennemy unit in half range   To me this would be correct:   - Bolter discipline replaces rapid fire range anyways, so x2 shots wether or not the target is in half range  - Rapid fire stratagem allows the intercessor squad to fire again, INCLUDING the bolter discipline bonus, so x2 shots again  In total there would then be 20 shots, and not compounding to 40. After that, the ennemy player started his turn, did not shoot, declared a charge, so I used overwatch, and we agreed that rapid fire also applied, so 10 shots again   Is our interpretation of that correct, or does rapid fire not count when doing overwatch ?

title: Two new Pokémon have been revealed: Great Tusk and Iron Treads
self_text: The Scarlet Book and the Violet Book📷📷  The Scarlet Book, which will appear in  Pokémon Scarlet , and the Violet Book, which will appear in  Pokémon Violet , are records from an expedition, and they were written long, long ago. The expedition is said to have traversed an uncharted area of the Paldea region, but whether or not the accounts depicted in the books are true remains unclear. It seems Arven always carries a copy of one of the books with him.  📷📷  Photographs and sketches of unidentified creatures fill the pages of the Scarlet Book and Violet Book. While there have been sightings of similar creatures in recent years, such reports are rare, and specific details of the creatures’ biology are still a mystery.  📷📷📷  The Monster Known as Great Tusk  The book describes how this savage monster attacked the expedition team with its large body and tusks, mortally wounding one of the explorers.  📷  The Monster Known as Iron Treads  It is said that when this monster curls its body and rolls to attack, it leaves a trail gouged into the ground, as if it had scorched the earth.  Note: Great Tusk will be depicted in the Scarlet Book, and Iron Treads will be depicted in the Violet Book.     https://scarletviolet.pokemon.com/en-us/news/books/

title: This Movie made me dislike Shanks
self_text: I must say that whether you liked the film, Uta or not, I felt the whole story was super forced. Before anyone says anything to me, UTA'S MOTIVATIONS AT AN EMOTIONAL LEVEL ARE UNDERSTANDING, I mean at the story/event level:  Uta doesn't seem to have lived 7 years of her life as a pirate: A girl who doesn't like to get dirty, who loves jewellery, who is characteristically naive and spoiled... Was she brought up by a gang of drunken pirates who dress like they bathe once a week and canonically plunder ships? Even their treatment of music doesn't fit, how pirates who sing Bink's Sake end up with a mini diva, who they fawn over like a goddess when she is a 9 year old girl who never had any musical education? Even in extra material she doesn't seem to know that BM is a pirate or that what is a bounty! (Uta's Diary)  Shanks is a shitty father in every way:  The reasons for abandoning Uta while understandable in context do not justify his actions, why blame you for genocide when there is a literal demon you could blame? Why not say that anyone released the demon or that a third party did it?  Why leave her with a stranger instead of leaving her with some powerful ally who could protect her or Luffy? Considering what happened with Ace, leaving Uta (the daughter of an emperor) on her own puts her in more danger than being a pirate and innocent people as well.   Didn't anyone think that leaving Uta to study to be a singer would put her in the global public eye and only bring more trouble because it would attract unwanted people who would seek her out for her DF?   Why leave your daughter, who is the only person capable of freeing a demon on the island where that demon is?   Why did Shanks never want to meet Uta again to explain the truth or at least see if she was okay once she was an adult?  Why did Shanks forget about his daughter, especially once he became emperor and had the means to protect her better than anyone else in the world both from herself and the world?  Uta could be used to get to him, even Elegy could be attacked and she could hurt innocents again in seeking to defend herself, the responsible thing would be to take Uta and prepare her to know the truth someday and be able to bear the responsibility of her power, not abandon a traumatized super-powered child to her fate and never return. But this theme is never explored, he tries to justify Shanks but Uta has worthy reasons not to forgive her father, which is a pity because this event could make Shanks more human.  Shanks is worse off if the film is not canon:  because it means that Uta was forgotten by his father and is still isolated on her island or died at some point without any closure to his conflict, but we will never get any kind of reflection or drama from Shanks about it because the film exists and Uta will never be relevant again. This is made worse when you consider that Shanks is patronised as a protector of the younger generation when the only one he cares about is Luffy. (Ch. 1055)  Suicide: they spend the whole movie trying to sell that Shanks loves her. Maybe it's just my opinion on this, but if your child doesn't want to live (commit suicide), you don't let her act on it, especially if she wants to escape reality. Letting an extremely unstable girl (drugged) suicide with her own father allowed it. The worst thing is that the justification is poor, Uta needs to sing or die to free everyone? it contradicts what was previously established by her powers and comes out of nowhere, how does Uta know that?  Extra: A good plan   ⁠Tor music attacks  ⁠Shanks beats him, uta asleep  ⁠Gordon explains the situation  ⁠Shanks takes Uta and Gordon on his boat  ⁠Uta wakes up  ⁠Everyone tells her that an earthquake destroyed the island /or that Tot musica destroyed the island but they say they don't know what the demon was.   ⁠Shanks convinces Uta that she is not pirate material and that she would be happier being a singer, besides that being her daughter could bring her problems if she becomes famous.  ⁠They leave Gordon and Uta on an island, it could be in Fusha, so she could grow up with Luffy  ⁠Shanks leaves but on good terms and with a Uta without trauma (They could still see each other occasionally or talk on Den Den/write letters to each other)  Give me a plot hole in this plan   Or left Gordon somewhere and continue with their life’s normally

title: God of War: Ragnarok NOT A 10/10
self_text: SPOILER ALERT     SPOILER ALERT    I want to start by saying that I think the game is a masterpiece visually. The art direction is out of this world, and the gameplay coming straight from GOW2018 means the actual gameplay is great too (if not a bit too overly familiar). The side content of climbing the living tortoise in Svartlfeim and releasing the giant Jellyfish in Alfeim for instance were also amazing.  I am however profoundly disappointed in the main story, writing and boss fights. The story never came anywhere close to moments like rediscovering the blades of chaos, undoing Kraros’ arm bandages atop the highest peak in Jotunheim, or stepping into the Light beam in Alfeim in GOW2018.   •Odin killing Thor is lazy writing.   •Artreus destroying the mask for no reason is lazy writing (he spends the entire game seeking answers. Why not just use the mask after dealing with Odin? Because that would require actually thinking up something compelling to be inside the crack in the first place. The plot point went absolutely nowhere).   •Sif/Thrud radically going 180 and turning against Odin despite us murdering her own children is lazy writing  •Freya deciding to team up with Kratos again for no reason out of nowhere after the disguised Valkyrie fight was lazy writing.   •There’s even the token sacrifice of a character scene that’s supposed to feel emotional but because they were never developed even remotely we don’t care at all (the dude with the beard and the big sword who jumps off the boat after saving Freyr). And then there’s a stupid needless sacrifice scene where Freyr sacrifices himself FOR ABSOLUTELY NO REASON. It’s just very bad writing.   •And there’s more examples than I can cite  Second, the boss fights for Odin and Thor are so forgettable. This is Ragnarok! God of War 3 12 years ago did an apocalypse better than this. This should have been an truly epic fight like we had against Poseidon or Zeus. It just seemed so lazy. So rushed.  I do not know how on earth you could play this game and call it a 10/10. The perfect game! Games journalism is a joke. Wtf even is IGN

title: There's one scene I wished they could have done better in Film Red
self_text: While I enjoyed the overall film, I felt that there was one scene that they could have done better, which is the twist scene where Uta has already been known the truth regarding the destruction of Eligia overall.  Although I don't think this twist ruined the Uta's motivation in film, in fact it actually helps to explain why Uta's New Genesis plan has been way too extreme, but the way movie displayed this revelation is way too consulted and confusing that it makes the viewers, ESPECIALLY the first-time viewers, difficult to understand Uta's whole motivation without supplementary material (Like Chronicles of UTA) or rewatching the movie several time to REALLY understand the plot.  What could have done is that they could add extra few lines during the twist scene with Uta saying she has no right to hate pirates, but she had to keep going because there already way too many fans listening her fans and cries about their suffering because of the pirates, and she couldn't let her fans down, or add the scene where Shanks (or Luffy) asks her why she did it and Uta responds by saying after she realized the truth, she has been consumed with so much guilt that she believed she didn't deserved to be loved, but she has to keep going as "Pirate-hating Uta" because there way too much fans who follows her and she doesn't wanted to let them down. And admitting that she initiated new genesis plan as the mean for atonement for what she did as well as she wanted to see Shanks one last time.  Had this scenes or lines, it would have way easier for watchers to understand why Uta did it in film.

title: Is Stellaris worth my time? (serious)
self_text: Hi all,  I'll be honest, I don't game properly much - I'm super busy, but when I can, I really enjoy the gaming I can fit in. I'm a hardcore starcraft: brood war fan, and enjoyed SCII when I had time for it. I'm far more likely to play mobile games here and there, broadly in the RTS genre, with some games leaning more toward factory building, others a lot like Stellaris. When my city was locked down for COVID, I bought Anno 1800, and really enjoyed that too. Next on my list of recommendations was Stellaris, and I have to admit - it doesn't seem that fun.   I see a handful of elements which make for interesting gameplay, and a rich depth of possibilities to explore (particularly with all the DLC), but I'm just not particularly enticed by the central premises to bother continuing to dig.  Am I missing something with this game, or is it just not for me? I've got plenty more on my list of games to check out, but before I go buy something else, it's there anything I should check out first in Stellaris? I know the purchase price is probably nothing to serious gamers, but I feel like this really wasn't worth the investment.  Apologies if this seems like trolling, I'm honestly looking for suggestions.

title: Just finished the entirety of the game and oh my god…. (lots of spoilers ahead)
self_text: The last Palace really really hit home for me. It was so hard not to give into Maruki’s reality. I know this is just a game but man it felt like he was speaking to me.   For the past 3 years I haven’t been happy with myself or the way my life has been. I really wished things were different, I even actually thought about how life actually sucks for a lot of people out there. It’s a lot of suffering, it takes so much to get out of the it. Sometimes you can’t even get out of it and before you know it you’re dead.  To me Maruki wasn’t even a villain, I will gladly live in his reality that he makes for me. It’s honestly something I wish for the most. I wish no pain on anyone. It took a lot to not cry but here I am bawling my eyes out. It honestly sucks that something like this isn’t real 😓  I can see why this could be a bad thing but a person can only take so much…  Just sharing how this game impacted me, I almost can’t put into words how Maruki affected me.

title: An Idea for Pokemon
self_text: I've been playing Voilet and enjoying it, but I'm seeing all the posts and concerns for the lack of scaled leveling. All the talk had me thinking.   Who has played Shadows of Mordor? That game had a unique feature that I dont understand why more games do not take from. It was a nemesis system. It had different orcs that could grow with you and become leaders. And any time an orc beat you, he promoted. It is a neat idea if you have never tried it check it out.  Anyways, I think this would work GREAT for a pokemon game. Either a main title or a legends game could us this. If a trainer beats you, they promote. Maybe to gym leader or maybe to one of the trainers inside the gym. The gyms and trainers around you would always change. It would make the worlds feel so much more real and dynamic. Feels weird that you and your rival are pretty much the only two trying to really become a pokemon master in a whole world of pokemon.

title: Wanted to make a shooting specialist "Lancer Captain" Mechinator which leads a regiment of lancers. Shooting aura don't seem to affect mechs? In fact specialists don't seem to have any synergy and is actually bad as Mechinators?
self_text: My first idea was to make a Lancer Captain (shooting specialist) mechinator which leads a regiment of lancers. But the shooting specialist aura don't seem to work at them? Is this a tool tip aura mix-up from the devs or does mechs not count as allies?  Second I tried making a Mech obsessed craftsmen guild with production specialists. But since they can't haul this causes a lot of not only non-existent synergy. But is actually damaging. Shooting specialists had (and have) the same issue of not being able to craft too. But for roleplaying I decided to suffer through assigning and reassigning them.  It seems none of the specialists, even the leader's combat command, does anything.  It's kinda sad to see that you can't hyper specialize specialists further into mechinators.  Posted this as feedback (in hopes for change). And as a PSA so people who are into roleplaying don't fall into the same traps as me thinking this would be cool thematically and interesting from a gameplay standpoint.  It really sucks but specialists don't have any good combos to offer as mechinators.
